headline: Kielbasa with Peppers and Potatoes
description: An easy kielbasa recipe combines this smokey sausage with red and yellow bell peppers and potatoes. A simple, satisfying dish that everyone will love.

video.description: Savory and smoky flavors combine for this delicious meal!
video.name: Kielbasa with Peppers and Potatoes

name: Kielbasa with Peppers and Potatoes
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) package smoked kielbasa sausage, diced

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place kielbasa and potatoes in the pan. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, about 25 minutes.
Mix bell peppers into the pan, and continue cooking until peppers are just tender, 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Added sliced onions and a dash or two of cayenne pepper. Whole family loved it.
I prepared this recipe almost as presented all I added was a small red onion finely chopped. It seemed to add a little punch
I used onion too
I buy kielbasa from a place where it is made. There is no grease. Everything was very good.
I make this alot but I add 1 onion sliced and 4 cloves of garlic sauted in the oil first along with tropical candied yams

It is a good recipe. I did notice that this Chef didn’t use onions in the recipe. The onions and peppers is really what makes the flavor of the kielbasa. I was really surprised that they didn’t include onions in this recipe? CT.
Tasty and super easy!!
Added onions. Mixed it with eggs for breakfast. Very good
Added shallots and red onions i had laying around. Salt and pepper and steak seasoning. topped with Cotija cheese and served it in a warm tortilla. Delish

I have been making this for years but with a few modifications. I add a sweet onion cut into half inch wedges, half of a red onion cut into half inch wedges, a green bell pepper, salt, pepper , garlic powder and olive oil. I toss everything with olive oil and the seasoning (to taste) and roast in the oven until vegetables are done. I’ve used red potatoes, gold Yukon potatoes and russets (russets take a bit longer to cook) and a mixture of all 3. This recipe is very versatile! It’s one of my fiancé’s favorite dinners.

I live in Guatemala and have to "make do" with sausage here. I usually make this with longanizas (like chorizo but not spicy) and then adjust the flavor with some good smokey paprika I brought back from the US. Like others, I usually add garlic because garlic, and grow herbs here so normally toss in some thyme and parsley or cilantro. But the base is what is important. And the base is easy, nutritious, inexpensive and relatively quick to make. Here it is called salchi-papas, for salchichas and papas. And to make pan cleanup really quick, just a few minutes before serving add a little water to the pan as it finishes cooking. The veggies will be perfectly soft and the food won't stick to the pan.
Fast, yummy and easy to make. I substituted the potatoes for pierogies and added onions.

I loved it! I've made it before without the potatoes. I added fresh garlic, black pepper and Ms Dash. The kids loved it and for me, the next morning heat it up and add some scrambled eggs a bit a cheese and it makes a great leftover omelet!
Yummy! I added mushrooms and red onion with a little garlic and herbs added. Looking forward to the left overs for tomorrow!

I have made per recipe many times and only added seasonings and a little bit of water to create steam. I've also added brussel sprouts several times. I blanch them first. Thanks for a great foundation recipe.

I made a few changes to make this more flavorful. I started with roasting fresh minced garlic in butter. After a few, I added some finely diced onions. When the garlic has a nice roasted texture and the onions had caramelized, I put in the potatoes. I used small red and yellow potatoes with fine tender skin. I sliced and cooked the kielbasa separately. This lowers greasiness and makes timing the doneness easier. Add together, then add chunky sliced onions. Let cook for a few minutes then add peppers. Cook until peppers are just tender.
Great, easy recipe! I definitely cut the potatoes too small and they were a little too soft, but the flavor was still there. Next time I’ll add onions too, they always flavor .
It was pretty good, basic of omitting bread that would be a kielbasa sandwich
This was really good. The second time I made it, I drizzled some Italian dressing over the top before baking and do prefer it with the extra kick.
Very tasty. The best thing about this is how fast and simple it is. I did follow the advice of other reviews and sauteed the peppers first (and added a small onion, and 1/2 tsp of Italian seasoning).
I followed the suggestion by Marisa R and it was awesome! I used turkey kielbasa and it wasn't greasy at all. Also, for a sweet note, added some chucked fresh pineapple at the end. Yum!!!!!
Used brats instead of kielbasa, green peppers instead of the red and yellow

I thought this was a great recipe. The only thing I did a little different was instead of adding the vegetable oil to the pan, I mixed my cubed potatoes with Salt & Pepper, onion power and garlic powder, and used just enough of the vegetable oil to coat the potatoes. I placed them in the pan first, then the kielbasa on top. This dish turned out wonderful!! Very satisfying, and even better the next day for breakfast with a fried egg on top!
Made it last night and really enjoyed it. I took the advice of another reviewer and boiled the sausage first. I also added a sprinkling of cayenne pepper at the end.
I used turkey kielbasa and turnips because of health issues. Also added some garlic powder for flavor. It was very tasty.
Added shallots and red onions i had laying around. Salt and pepper and steak seasoning. topped with Cojita cheese and served it in a warm tortilla. Delish
Always a hit. Switch up the veggies as needed. So versatile!

Pretty good mixture. I added a bit of Omaha Steaks seasoning just because it seemed odd not to have a seasoning, but who knows, maybe it wouldn't have been needed. It was good though. Seems like a nice basic recipe that would be easy to make your own with veggie or spice additions.
Delicious. I added slices of onion in with the peppers. Will definitely make this again.
It was a quick and easy dinner for a busy day. Family loved it. Definitely will make it again.

I read a lot of the suggestions, but wanted to try it just as it is written. So I made it just as is. This is surprising good for such a small list of ingredients! Mine was not greasy at all, may have been the brand if Kielbasa I used, I dont know. I will for sure be making this again. I do agree with a few post about adding carrots and celery. if I have it needing used up I would sure throw it in next time, but you can't go wrong with it just as is. Thank you for a simple but great recipe
This meal looked and tasted great. It was very quick and easy to prepare. Next time I am going to add garlic and red onion to this mix.
husband love it. made it exactly how recipe said, but i m8ght add onions next
Yummy but a bit greasy.
This was a good recipe, though added a sweet yellow onion to the dish.
As written, it wouldn't get 4 stars. But, with the addition of onions, minced garlic, salt, pepper, butter it boosted it to a flavorful and easy recipe.
We loved this receipt. I added onions,garlic, and leftover broccoli. I will definitely be making this again.

I dump a bag of baby potatoes, a sliced red bell pepper, sliced yellow bell pepper, and a sliced large red onion into a castiron skillet with some olive oil and seasoning salt. I bake on 350° for 10 to 15 minutes and then add pieces of Earl Campbell's Polish Kielbasa 40 Oz and bake for another 20 minutes until the Kielbasa starts to sear.

I then have to fight my to teenaged sons for my portion.
easy, quick and yummy.
I added slices of green bell pepper, too.

Quarantine Dream! I’m going to the grocery every two weeks these days and these ingredients last into the second week. I used the exact ingredients but I cooked the potatoes until almost done in the air fryer. Started the kielbasa, drained it, added potatoes until they were crispy outside, then added peppers. I’ll probably add onion the next time but really it’s great just as is. Thanks for a wonderful recipe.
Easy and tasty for a quick main dish.

Great recipe. Thanks to other reviewers for tips. I didn't have peppers so I used onions, carrots, & zucchini instead. I used canned potatoes since that's what I had on hand. I did add salt, pepper, and garlic. The garlic was great with this recipe. I used butter & olive oil instead of just oil to help with cooking the veggies. I cooked the onions & carrots first since carrots usually take awhile to cook. After 7-10 minutes, I added the garlic & cooked for another minute. Then I added the zucchini & kielbasa & cooked for another 5 before adding the canned potatoes, which I did cut into quarters. I cooked all of that for another 20-25 minutes. I did stir it often, more than only every 10 minutes, based on others' comments that it stuck to the pan. Delicious! Will definitely make again.

I made this using onions and a few carrots in place of the peppers. Delicious. Even better - sauté leftovers until the potatoes are crispy, top with an over easy egg and serve for breakfast. I will definitely be making this again.
Delicious but I lost half the mass of the potatoes because they stick to the bottom of the pan. I even added additional oil.

This was very good. I cooked this in the oven. I put the potatoes in the oven by themselves for 20 mins at 375. Then I browned the kielbasa and added it and the peppers then cooked another 20 mins. It turned at perfect.

I used smoked turkey sausage sliced to reduce the fat content and added some minced garlic and Italian seasoning as well. I had no problem with too much juices. I did have to reduce the heat to medium low after 10 mins. Wonderful flavor and so easy!

I took one of the reviewers suggestion and baked this in the oven at 400* starting with the potatoes then ten minutes later adding the onions and peppers. Ten minutes later I added the kielbasa, baking for an additional 10 minutes. My husband loved it.
Delicious! I've made this twice already this month, once as directed by the recipe and once with my own modifications, using tips from other reviewers. Thank you for this delicious easy recipe!!!
OMG. Amazing. My whole family loved it. I added onion and garlic.
My family loves it!
Will definitely make it again
Delicious! I used olive oil instead of vegetable oil. Will definitely make again!
It came out really good and my husband loved it.

Quick week night meal. Out of preference though I skipped the oil and let the kielbasa create the oil when frying. I let it get nicely browned & then I added some onion & garlic as others suggested. After the onion & garlic fries for a few minutes I put in the diced red potatoes. Make sure you dice small and it doesn't need to cook as long. Finally added my red peppers & had a veggie with it. Very filling. You don't need salt because the sausage has enough. I may try andouille sausage for a little more kick. Will make again.
What a quick, colorful, and tasty dish! I'll definitely make again.

Good starting point. Like someone else, I added other veggies that I wanted to use-broccoli & onion as well as sweet red peppers & just three russet potatoes. I diced everything (not broc) small and sprinkled it generously with Montreal steak seasoning.

Added onions, garlic powder, carrots , mushrooms, and celery. Cooked potatoes and onions first. In another skillet cooked carrots and celery. Added mushrooms and yellow pepper to that skillet. Added kielbasa to the potatoes then the vegetable mixture. Put some vegetable broth in as well. Separated the kielbasa to get it browned nicely and then returned it to the dish. It was excellent! Will definitely make again.
It turned out really good. I didn’t have Kielbasa but did have hot links so used those. Hubby’s not really into potatoes but he too likes the dish.

I read many reviews and decided to use ideas from a couple of them. I boiled my kielbasa for about 20 minutes to help get rid of some of the fat. I cut the peppers, some onion and potatoes into pieces approximately the same size. I tossed them all in olive oil and seasoned them with Mrs. Dash original seasoning. I put the potatoes on a sheet pan 1st as suggested by one reviewer In the oven at 375 and then added the peppers and onions after about 10 minutes. I browned the kielbasa in a cast iron skillet and added it to the vegetables. Right before the vegetables were done I added some grape tomatoes that needed to be used. It was delicious. There was a small amount leftover which I heated in the microwave and put an over easy egg on top for my lunch today. That was very good too.

This is a great recipe that can be adjusted to suit your needs. I used a package of 5 Hillshire Farms cheddar sausages. I cut them up and fried them in a small amount of olive oil. Added them to a glass dish along with the peppers and potatoes. Added some Italian seasoning, garlic salt, salt and pepper. Baked in the oven until the potatoes and peppers were tender. The hubby had seconds and thirds. We love the recipe. It's a quick and satisfying meal. Thanks!
The whole family loved this recipe and it was so easy to make! It has been added to our favorite meals.

Next time I will brown the kielbasa, set aside, and then add the potatoes to brown in the same pan, adding oil as needed. They didn't get browned enough when sautéing everything at once. When they are almost done, I'll add the peppers to cook for a while and then I'll add the kielbasa and finish. I will also try adding some sliced onion next time.
Very good and very filling. Just added onions and garlic. Hubby said to add it to the rotation.
Added onions, yum!
Easy to make and delicious!
Yummy. I only changed it to add some onion to it as I like onion with peppers and potatoes.

Very tasty! I used turkey kielbasa, and I think the extra fat of regular kielbasa would have added a bit more flavor and helped the potatoes brown more evenly. Next time I will also saute the bell peppers first, set aside, and then add them and heat through at the end.

I made this dish with changes I used green pepper, garlic and hot chicken sausage from the butcher I cut everything into uniform pieces And I roasted it all in the oven Delicious . Lots of flavor . Not greasy.
no changes and e1 loved it!!
I used a frozen onion and pepper mixture. Made for a quick satisfying meal

"It was delicious and very easy to make. it did require some attention while on the range, but I made myself a drink to help whittle the time. I added 1/4 cup V-8 for some flavorful liquid. 



















I definitely will make this again, many times.

Wow was this an easy and tasty dish. I made this for a pot luck luncheon. It was a hit.I cooked in oven then put in crock pot to keep warm .i would do this again,and again.
I didn’t add or change anything,very flavorful
Quick, easy, full of flavor. We added a little kick with fresh jalapeno peppers.
I added chopped onion and garlic.
this is an excellent meal..I had plenty and froze the rest..had it for dinner last night and it is as good now as it was then...great recipes on this site....

This was a very tasty dish. I sautéed garlic in olive oil before adding the kielbasa and potatoes, also added Montreal seasoning that was suggested by another poster. I doubled the recipe, because I have two teenage boys. They ate it all, no leftovers. Will be putting this recipe into the rotation.
I already had a potato dish made so I did not add the potatoes. I did add a can of mushrooms though-yum! Cut up green, yellow, orange and red peppers. So colorful! Hubby and BIL loved it!

Perfect but I added things - half an onion, minced garlic and salt and pepper to taste. I also used a green pepper instead of a yellow one. I didn’t dice the sausage, sliced it instead - more aesthetically pleasing, and the illustration showed it sliced, anyway. It was totally scrumptious!
Used a cheaper version of smoked sausage

I was really surprised how good this was. Extremely quick and easy to make. I added some onion but otherwise followed the recipe. Did need a little salt and pepper but adding afterward to your personal taste is recommended. Definitely will be making this again.

I read some of the reviews and they were very helpful. I ended up cooking peppers and onions separately, browning the potatoes and setting aside. I spiced the potatoes with Lawry’s Seasoning Salt, pepper, garlic powder, and a little oregano. After browning the kielbasa, I added all the other ingredients and warmed a bit. My husband loved it and suggested I add more onions next time. Thanks for the recipe.
Love allrecipes.com! This recipe is a keeper.

Turned out very good. I seasoned the potatoes with some olive oil, seasoning salt and S&P in a bag before I put them in the pan with the sausage. it added additional flavor. I added some penne pasta when it was all cooked. Great meal.
Delicious
Tossed it all with Olive oil, wrapped it all up in foil, cooked it on the grill for 45 minutes. Yummy
Boil the sausage first
Very easy to make, hubby loved it, will be making it again.

I made this for Father's Day lunch for my husband and father in law who are huge kielbasa fans and they LOVED IT! Even my 1 year old and 4 year old ate it, and they eat nothing. Great recipe! It will, for sure, become a staple in my house.

I use yellow potatoes instead of red. Since I had green peppers in hand that’s what used. They came out delicious I decided to make this for Father’s Day plus I made eggs over easy plus toast and let’s not forget the Orange juice.

Nice meal. It's a two meal deal for us, my wife and me. I did zip it up a little by using sweet and spicy sausages. We're having a little get together in few weeks, this will be on the menu, along with the capers burgers.
We used cherizo to give a little spice definitely worth making again!
I added some sliced onions and a touch of BBQue sauce. It is easy to make and it's delicious!!!
I added some sliced onions and a touch of BBQue sauce. It is easy to make and it's delicious!!!
I just made it with extra kielbasa. It was so delicious. And I had mustard on the side for a few bites. Very good. Will definatly make again
It is easy, simple & delicious I made no changes, was perfect as is. I used the Eckridge brand of Kabasa
Very good and definitely will make it again. Next time I might use turkey sausage.
I made a couple of changes to it. I added two cloves of fresh garlic and a teaspoon of oregano to it and it was amazing!!!
Turned out great!
